revised_title: Pendulum Experiments to Determine Earth's Mean Density at Harton Colliery
tldr: The author conducted pendulum experiments at the Harton Colliery to determine the mean density of the Earth. The results showed that gravity below the surface is greater than above by 0.8 parts, with an uncertainty of 0.5 parts of the excess. The mean density of the Earth was calculated to be 26,266, which the author believes may compete on equal terms with previous experiments.
